trans-unit.source: Create and restore a backup in BizTalk Services | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Create and restore a backup in BizTalk Services | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: BizTalk Services includes Backup and Restore. Learn how to create and restore a backup and determine what gets backed up. MABS, WABS
trans-unit.target: BizTalk Services includes Backup and Restore. Learn how to create and restore a backup and determine what gets backed up. MABS, WABS

trans-unit.source: Azure BizTalk Services includes Backup and Restore capabilities.
trans-unit.target: Azure BizTalk Services includes Backup and Restore capabilities.

trans-unit.source: This topic describes how to backup and restore BizTalk Services using the Azure Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes how to backup and restore BizTalk Services using the Azure Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: You can also back up BizTalk Services using the <linkText>BizTalk Services REST API</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: You can also back up BizTalk Services using the <linkText>BizTalk Services REST API</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Backup and Restore may not be available for all editions.
trans-unit.target: Backup and Restore may not be available for all editions.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>BizTalk Services: Editions Chart</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>BizTalk Services: Editions Chart</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Note Hybrid Connections are NOT backed up, regardless of the Edition.
trans-unit.target: Note Hybrid Connections are NOT backed up, regardless of the Edition.

trans-unit.source: Using the Azure Management Portal, you can create an On Demand backup or create a scheduled backup.
trans-unit.target: Using the Azure Management Portal, you can create an On Demand backup or create a scheduled backup.

trans-unit.source: Backup content can be restored to the same BizTalk Service or to a new BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: Backup content can be restored to the same BizTalk Service or to a new BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: To restore the BizTalk Service using the same name, the existing BizTalk Service must be deleted and the name must be available.
trans-unit.target: To restore the BizTalk Service using the same name, the existing BizTalk Service must be deleted and the name must be available.

trans-unit.source: After you delete a BizTalk Service, it can take longer time than wanted for the same name to be available.
trans-unit.target: After you delete a BizTalk Service, it can take longer time than wanted for the same name to be available.

trans-unit.source: If you cannot wait for the same name to be available, then restore to a new BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: If you cannot wait for the same name to be available, then restore to a new BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: BizTalk Services can be restored to the same edition or a higher edition.
trans-unit.target: BizTalk Services can be restored to the same edition or a higher edition.

trans-unit.source: Restoring BizTalk Services to a lower edition, from when the backup was taken, is not supported.
trans-unit.target: Restoring BizTalk Services to a lower edition, from when the backup was taken, is not supported.

trans-unit.source: For example, a backup using the Basic Edition can be restored to the Premium Edition.
trans-unit.target: For example, a backup using the Basic Edition can be restored to the Premium Edition.

trans-unit.source: A backup using the Premium Edition cannot be restored to the Standard Edition.
trans-unit.target: A backup using the Premium Edition cannot be restored to the Standard Edition.

trans-unit.source: The EDI Control numbers are backed up to maintain continuity of the control numbers.
trans-unit.target: The EDI Control numbers are backed up to maintain continuity of the control numbers.

trans-unit.source: If messages are processed after the last backup, restoring this backup content can cause duplicate control numbers.
trans-unit.target: If messages are processed after the last backup, restoring this backup content can cause duplicate control numbers.

trans-unit.source: If a batch has active messages, process the batch before running a backup.
trans-unit.target: If a batch has active messages, process the batch before running a backup.

trans-unit.source: When creating a backup (as needed or scheduled), messages in batches are never stored.
trans-unit.target: When creating a backup (as needed or scheduled), messages in batches are never stored.

trans-unit.source: If a backup is taken with active messages in a batch, these messages are not backed up and are therefore lost.
trans-unit.target: If a backup is taken with active messages in a batch, these messages are not backed up and are therefore lost.

trans-unit.source: Optional: In the BizTalk Services Portal, stop any management operations.
trans-unit.target: Optional: In the BizTalk Services Portal, stop any management operations.

trans-unit.source: A backup can be taken at any time and is completely controlled by you.
trans-unit.target: A backup can be taken at any time and is completely controlled by you.

trans-unit.source: This section lists the steps to create backups using the Azure Management Portal, including:
trans-unit.target: This section lists the steps to create backups using the Azure Management Portal, including:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>On Demand backup</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>On Demand backup</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Schedule a backup</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Schedule a backup</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, select BizTalk Services, and then select the BizTalk Service you want to backup.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, select BizTalk Services, and then select the BizTalk Service you want to backup.

trans-unit.source: In the Dashboard tab, select Back up at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: In the Dashboard tab, select Back up at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: Enter a backup name.
trans-unit.target: Enter a backup name.

trans-unit.source: For example, enter myBizTalkServiceBUDate.
trans-unit.target: For example, enter myBizTalkServiceBUDate.

trans-unit.source: Choose a blob storage account and select the checkmark to start the backup.
trans-unit.target: Choose a blob storage account and select the checkmark to start the backup.

trans-unit.source: Once the backup completes, a container with the backup name you enter is created in the storage account.
trans-unit.target: Once the backup completes, a container with the backup name you enter is created in the storage account.

trans-unit.source: This container contains your BizTalk Service backup configuration.
trans-unit.target: This container contains your BizTalk Service backup configuration.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, select BizTalk Services, select the BizTalk Service name you want to schedule the backup, and then select the Configure tab.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, select BizTalk Services, select the BizTalk Service name you want to schedule the backup, and then select the Configure tab.

trans-unit.source: Set the Backup Status to Automatic.
trans-unit.target: Set the Backup Status to Automatic.

trans-unit.source: Select the Storage Account to store the backup, enter the Frequency to create the backups, and how long to keep the backups (Retention Days):
trans-unit.target: Select the Storage Account to store the backup, enter the Frequency to create the backups, and how long to keep the backups (Retention Days):

trans-unit.source: Notes
trans-unit.target: Notes

trans-unit.source: In Retention Days, the retention period must be greater than the backup frequency.
trans-unit.target: In Retention Days, the retention period must be greater than the backup frequency.

trans-unit.source: Select Always keep at least one backup, even if it is past the retention period.
trans-unit.target: Select Always keep at least one backup, even if it is past the retention period.

trans-unit.source: Select Save.
trans-unit.target: Select Save.

trans-unit.source: When a scheduled backup job runs, it creates a container (to store backup data) in the storage account you entered.
trans-unit.target: When a scheduled backup job runs, it creates a container (to store backup data) in the storage account you entered.

trans-unit.source: The name of the container is named BizTalk Service Name-date-time.
trans-unit.target: The name of the container is named BizTalk Service Name-date-time.

trans-unit.source: If the BizTalk Service dashboard shows a Failed status:
trans-unit.target: If the BizTalk Service dashboard shows a Failed status:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Last scheduled backup status</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Last scheduled backup status</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The link opens the Management Services Operation Logs to help troubleshoot.
trans-unit.target: The link opens the Management Services Operation Logs to help troubleshoot.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>BizTalk Services: Troubleshoot using operation logs</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>BizTalk Services: Troubleshoot using operation logs</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: You can restore backups from the Azure Management Portal or from the <linkText>Restore BizTalk Service REST API</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: You can restore backups from the Azure Management Portal or from the <linkText>Restore BizTalk Service REST API</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: This section lists the steps to restore using the Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: This section lists the steps to restore using the Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: New tracking, archiving, and monitoring stores can be entered while restoring a BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: New tracking, archiving, and monitoring stores can be entered while restoring a BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: The same EDI Runtime data is restored.
trans-unit.target: The same EDI Runtime data is restored.

trans-unit.source: The EDI Runtime backup stores the control numbers.
trans-unit.target: The EDI Runtime backup stores the control numbers.

trans-unit.source: The restored control numbers are in sequence from the time of the backup.
trans-unit.target: The restored control numbers are in sequence from the time of the backup.

trans-unit.source: If messages are processed after the last backup, restoring this backup content can cause duplicate control numbers.
trans-unit.target: If messages are processed after the last backup, restoring this backup content can cause duplicate control numbers.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, select New > App Services > BizTalk Service > Restore:
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, select New > App Services > BizTalk Service > Restore:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Restore a backup</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Restore a backup</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In Backup URL, select the folder icon and expand the Azure storage account that stores the BizTalk Service configuration backup.
trans-unit.target: In Backup URL, select the folder icon and expand the Azure storage account that stores the BizTalk Service configuration backup.

trans-unit.source: Expand the container and in the right pane, select the corresponding back up .txt file.
trans-unit.target: Expand the container and in the right pane, select the corresponding back up .txt file.

trans-unit.source: Select Open.
trans-unit.target: Select Open.

trans-unit.source: On the Restore BizTalk Service page, enter a BizTalk Service Name and verify the Domain URL, Edition, and Region for the restored BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: On the Restore BizTalk Service page, enter a BizTalk Service Name and verify the Domain URL, Edition, and Region for the restored BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: Create a new SQL database instance for the tracking database:
trans-unit.target: Create a new SQL database instance for the tracking database:

trans-unit.source: Select the next arrow.
trans-unit.target: Select the next arrow.

trans-unit.source: Verify the name of the SQL database, enter the physical server where the SQL database will be created, and a username/password for that server.
trans-unit.target: Verify the name of the SQL database, enter the physical server where the SQL database will be created, and a username/password for that server.

trans-unit.source: If you want to configure the SQL database edition, size, and other properties, select Configure Advanced Database Settings.
trans-unit.target: If you want to configure the SQL database edition, size, and other properties, select Configure Advanced Database Settings.

trans-unit.source: Select the next arrow.
trans-unit.target: Select the next arrow.

trans-unit.source: Create a new storage account or enter an existing storage account for the BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: Create a new storage account or enter an existing storage account for the BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: Select the checkmark to start the restore.
trans-unit.target: Select the checkmark to start the restore.

trans-unit.source: Once the restoration successfully completes, a new BizTalk Service is listed in a suspended state on the BizTalk Services page in the Azure Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: Once the restoration successfully completes, a new BizTalk Service is listed in a suspended state on the BizTalk Services page in the Azure Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: The BizTalk Service is always restored in a Suspended state.
trans-unit.target: The BizTalk Service is always restored in a Suspended state.

trans-unit.source: In this state, you can make any configuration changes before the new environment is functional, including:
trans-unit.target: In this state, you can make any configuration changes before the new environment is functional, including:

trans-unit.source: If you created BizTalk Service applications using the Azure BizTalk Services SDK, you may need to to update the Access Control (ACS) credentials in those applications to work with the restored environment.
trans-unit.target: If you created BizTalk Service applications using the Azure BizTalk Services SDK, you may need to to update the Access Control (ACS) credentials in those applications to work with the restored environment.

trans-unit.source: You restore a BizTalk Service to replicate an existing BizTalk Service environment.
trans-unit.target: You restore a BizTalk Service to replicate an existing BizTalk Service environment.

trans-unit.source: In this situation, if there are agreements configured in the original BizTalk Services portal that use a source FTP folder, you may need to update the agreements in the newly restored environment to use a different source FTP folder.
trans-unit.target: In this situation, if there are agreements configured in the original BizTalk Services portal that use a source FTP folder, you may need to update the agreements in the newly restored environment to use a different source FTP folder.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, there may be two different agreements trying to pull the same message.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, there may be two different agreements trying to pull the same message.

trans-unit.source: If you restored to have multiple BizTalk Service environments, make sure you target the correct environment in the Visual Studio applications, PowerShell cmdlets, REST APIs, or Trading Partner Management OM APIs.
trans-unit.target: If you restored to have multiple BizTalk Service environments, make sure you target the correct environment in the Visual Studio applications, PowerShell cmdlets, REST APIs, or Trading Partner Management OM APIs.

trans-unit.source: It's a good practice to configure automated backups on the newly restored BizTalk Service environment.
trans-unit.target: It's a good practice to configure automated backups on the newly restored BizTalk Service environment.

trans-unit.source: To start the BizTalk Service in the Azure Management Portal, select the restored BizTalk Service and select Resume in the task bar.
trans-unit.target: To start the BizTalk Service in the Azure Management Portal, select the restored BizTalk Service and select Resume in the task bar.

trans-unit.source: When a backup is created, the following items are backed up:
trans-unit.target: When a backup is created, the following items are backed up:

trans-unit.source: Items backed up
trans-unit.target: Items backed up

trans-unit.source: Azure BizTalk Services Portal
trans-unit.target: Azure BizTalk Services Portal

trans-unit.source: Configuration and Runtime
trans-unit.target: Configuration and Runtime

trans-unit.source: Partner and profile details
trans-unit.target: Partner and profile details

trans-unit.source: Partner Agreements
trans-unit.target: Partner Agreements

trans-unit.source: Custom assemblies deployed
trans-unit.target: Custom assemblies deployed

trans-unit.source: Bridges deployed
trans-unit.target: Bridges deployed

trans-unit.source: Certificates
trans-unit.target: Certificates

trans-unit.source: Transforms deployed
trans-unit.target: Transforms deployed

trans-unit.source: Pipelines
trans-unit.target: Pipelines

trans-unit.source: Templates created and saved in the BizTalk Services Portal
trans-unit.target: Templates created and saved in the BizTalk Services Portal

trans-unit.source: X12 ST01 and GS01 mappings
trans-unit.target: X12 ST01 and GS01 mappings

trans-unit.source: Control numbers (EDI)
trans-unit.target: Control numbers (EDI)

trans-unit.source: AS2 Message MIC values
trans-unit.target: AS2 Message MIC values

trans-unit.source: Azure BizTalk Service
trans-unit.target: Azure BizTalk Service

trans-unit.source: SSL Certificate
trans-unit.target: SSL Certificate

trans-unit.source: SSL Certificate Data
trans-unit.target: SSL Certificate Data

trans-unit.source: SSL Certificate Password
trans-unit.target: SSL Certificate Password

trans-unit.source: BizTalk Service Settings
trans-unit.target: BizTalk Service Settings

trans-unit.source: Scale unit count
trans-unit.target: Scale unit count

trans-unit.source: Edition
trans-unit.target: Edition

trans-unit.source: Product Version
trans-unit.target: Product Version

trans-unit.source: Region/Datacenter
trans-unit.target: Region/Datacenter

trans-unit.source: Access Control Service (ACS) namespace and key
trans-unit.target: Access Control Service (ACS) namespace and key

trans-unit.source: Tracking database connection string
trans-unit.target: Tracking database connection string

trans-unit.source: Archiving Storage account connection string
trans-unit.target: Archiving Storage account connection string

trans-unit.source: Monitoring storage account connection string
trans-unit.target: Monitoring storage account connection string

trans-unit.source: Additional Items
trans-unit.target: Additional Items

trans-unit.source: Tracking Database
trans-unit.target: Tracking Database

trans-unit.source: When the BizTalk Service is created, the Tracking Database details are entered, including the Azure SQL Database Server and the Tracking Database name. The Tracking Database is not automatically backed up.
trans-unit.target: When the BizTalk Service is created, the Tracking Database details are entered, including the Azure SQL Database Server and the Tracking Database name. The Tracking Database is not automatically backed up.

trans-unit.source: Important
trans-unit.target: Important

trans-unit.source: If the Tracking Database is deleted and the database needs recovered, a previous backup must exist. If a backup does not exist, the Tracking Database and its data are not recoverable. In this situation, create a new Tracking Database with the same database name. Geo-Replication is recommended.
trans-unit.target: If the Tracking Database is deleted and the database needs recovered, a previous backup must exist. If a backup does not exist, the Tracking Database and its data are not recoverable. In this situation, create a new Tracking Database with the same database name. Geo-Replication is recommended.

trans-unit.source: To create Azure BizTalk Services in the Azure Management Portal, go to <linkText>BizTalk Services: Provisioning Using Azure Management Portal</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: To create Azure BizTalk Services in the Azure Management Portal, go to <linkText>BizTalk Services: Provisioning Using Azure Management Portal</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: To start creating applications, go to <linkText>Azure BizTalk Services</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: To start creating applications, go to <linkText>Azure BizTalk Services</linkText><title></title>.
